required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MitraClip NT System Post-marketing Surveillance Study - Japan
clinical_study.official_title: MitraClip NT System Post -Marketing Surveillance Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the MitraClip post-marketing clinical use surveillance study is to observe the frequency, type and degree of adverse device effects and adverse events in order to assure the safety of the new medical device, and to collect safety and efficacy information for evaluating the results of the clinical use.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a prospective, mutli-center, single-arm post-marketing clinical use surveillance study. The Surveillance will consecutively register patients with moderate to severe and severe mitral regurgitation (3+ and 4+ MR) in whom a MitraClip implant was attempted. Patients registered in the AVJ-514 clinical trial who received additional MitraClip procedures will be excluded from the Surveillance.
Patients will be evaluated at Baseline, Procedure, Discharge, 30 days, 1 year, 2 years and 3 years in Japanese medical centers.

primary_outcome.description: SLDA is defined as the attachment of one mitral leaflet to the MitraClip® Device

primary_outcome.measure: No of Participants With Acute Procedural Success (APS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 7 days (Discharge visit) from Procedure date
primary_outcome.description: APS is defined as resulting MR reduction to ≤ 2+ per echocardiographic assessment. Mitral regurgitation severity is determined based on the American Society of Echocardiography (ASE) Recommendations for Evaluation of The Severity of Native Valvular Regurgitation with Two-Dimensional and Doppler Echocardiography. MR severity grade was assessed by the core lab using the transthoracic echocardiogram (TTE) at baseline, discharge and subsequent follow-up visits. The severity of MR is determined by the amount of blood being pushed back into the left atrium when it should be circulating through the left ventricle with each heart beat. MR severity is typically classified as mild (grade 1+), moderate (grade 2+), moderate to severe (grade 3+) or severe (grade 4+).

arm_group.description: Percutaneous mitral valve repair using MitraClip NT System

intervention.description: Percutaneous mitral valve repair using MitraClip NT System

study_pop.textblock: Post-marketing Surveillance will consecutively register patients with moderate to severe and severe mitral regurgitation (3+ and 4+ MR) in whom a MitraClip implant was attempted.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Refer to MitraClip IFU
Exclusion Criteria: Refer to MitraClip IFU

facility.name: Tokyo Bay Urayasu Ichikawa Medical Center
Hyogo Prefectural Amagasaki General Medical Center
University Hospital Kyoto Prefectural University of Medicine
The Sakakibara Heart Institute of Okayama
Saitama Medical University International Medical Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 500 subjects were enrolled at 40 sites April 2, 2018 to March 31, 2020.

measure.title: Society of Thoracic Surgeons (STS) Score
measure.description: The STS score is a validated risk-prediction model for open surgery based on data from the STS National Adult Cardiac Surgery Database. In general, an STS predicted risk of surgical mortality of 4%-8% is considered intermediate risk and 8% or greater is considered high risk. As of November 15, 2018, The Society of Thoracic Surgeons released an updated short-term risk calculator to reflect the latest 2018 adult cardiac surgery risk models. The STS Calculator allows you to calculate a patient's risk of mortality and morbidities for the most commonly performed cardiac surgeries.

measure.title: Cardiovascular History
measure.population: All available data has been presented.

measure.title: Cardiac Intervention History
measure.population: All available data has been reported.

measure.title: Co-Morbidity
measure.population: All available data has been reported

measure.title: Prior Heart Failure Hospitalization Within 1 year
measure.population: All available data has been reported.

measure.title: Baseline Effective Regurgitant Orifice Area
measure.description: Effective regurgitant orifice area is an important and clinically significant index of regurgitation severity. Effective regurgitant orifice area is calculated by Doppler echocardiography as the ratio of regurgitant volume/regurgitant jet time-velocity integral.
measure.population: Data was not available for all the subjects.

measure.title: Regurgitant Volume
measure.description: Regurgitant volume as determined by the Echocardiographic Core Laboratory (ECL). In the presence of regurgitation of one valve, without any intracardiac shunt, the flow through the affected valve is larger than through other competent valves. The difference between the two represents the regurgitant volume.
measure.population: Data was not available for all the subjects.

measure.title: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF)
measure.population: All available data has been reported.

measure.title: Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume (LVESV)
measure.description: Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume (LVESV) as measured by the Echocardiography Core Laboratory (ECL). Left Ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) measured using 2-dimensional echocardiography. The endocardium is traced at end-systole (frame prior to mitral valve opening or the minimum cavity area) in the 2- and 4-chamber views to calculate volumes.
measure.population: All available data has been reported.

measure.title: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume (LVEDV)
measure.description: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume (LVEDV) as measured by the site. Left Ventricular enddiastolic volume (LVEDV) measured using 2-dimensional echocardiography. The endocardium is traced at end-diastole (frame before mitral valve closure or maximum cavity dimension) in the 2- and 4-chamber views to calculate volumes.
measure.population: All available data has been reported.

measure.title: Serum Creatinine
measure.population: All available data has been reported.

measure.title: Brain Natriuretic Peptide (BNP)
measure.population: All available data has been reported

measure.title: N-terminal Prohormone of Brain Natriuretic Peptide (NT-proBNP Levels)
measure.population: All available data has been reported

outcome.title: Single Leaflet Device Attachment (SLDA) Rate
outcome.description: SLDA is defined as the attachment of one mitral leaflet to the MitraClip® Device
outcome.population: All subjects with available data were included for analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
